body:
Will merge it right now :)
Thanks for the contribution!
https://github.com/apache/openmeetings/commit/e2563c5a88035d686b45f5500b39e40e73918413

Just have tried to apply the patch

Unfortunately it wasn't successful, will try to manually merge

Hmm,
I was able to merge, BUT right now I'm not sure what to do next due to
1) 2 SNAPSHOT libraries are added to dependencies
2) HTTP client 3 is used instead of http client 4

Will try to contact caldav4j devs and clear this before commit

@solomax Addressing, the two issues you mentioned:

1) I did mention this previously. Though, could you specify which other library other than caldav4j is in SNAPSHOT stages?
I have actually tested it up, cleared most of the tests. I could talk with the dev and resolve the issue. Probably, getting a stable version out.
2) Http Client 3 unfortunately will have to be used because right now, Apache Jackrabbit, which CalDAV4j uses, still uses HTTP Client 3, and this is a work in progress. If they upgrade it, I'll be able to then migrate all of the code to HTTP Client 4. Here's Jackrabbit Issue JCR 2406: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/JCR-2406

Note: Jackrabbit - WebDAV, seems to be the recommended library for WebDAV, from Apache, which I mentioned during the initial stages.

weird enough caldav4j is the SNAPSHOT I can live with for now :)
But I was unable to build the project without adding https://github.com/caldav4j/caldav4j/tree/master/repo/com/github/caldav4j/jakarta-slide-webdavlib/2.2pre1-httpclient-3.0
via custom repo in build.xml

this is actually the thing I'm worried about
And of cause I would prefer to have no SNAPSHOTs at the time of release :)

@solomax In fact, getting rid of that extra SNAPSHOT, which you mention is what I worked on, initially. It's been removed on the jcr-dev branch. I normally compile it without the other extra snapshot. Though during compile, you might have to specify -DskipTests

Let me know, on the any other problems.

So I need to check out jcr-dev branch
Compile it
Make artifact available (put it to the private repo)
And that's it

OK will try it and let you know

Do you know is there any roadmap on releasing this version?

@solomax Yeah, that sounds good, though, the compiled 0.9-SNAPSHOT, as I mentioned is also available here on sonatype: https://oss.sonatype.org/content/groups/public/com/github/caldav4j/caldav4j/0.9-SNAPSHOT/

RoadMap, not really, but I can ask the maintainer. Will get back to you on that.
Thanks, will double-check ASAP

@TheAntimist I was able to compile, so it is OK for now to have SNAPSHOT dependency
Now I need time to clean-up formatting and whitespace issues, when going to merge it

@solomax Good to hear, if you need any further adjustments in any area, let me know.

Also, regarding the Import and Export, for easier conversion, I added two functions, namely [`parseAppointmentstoCalendar`](https://github.com/TheAntimist/openmeetings/blob/3.2.x/openmeetings-service/src/main/java/org/apache/openmeetings/service/calendar/caldav/iCalUtils.java#L437) and [`parseCalendartoAppointments`](https://github.com/TheAntimist/openmeetings/blob/3.2.x/openmeetings-service/src/main/java/org/apache/openmeetings/service/calendar/caldav/iCalUtils.java#L90), which might be helpful.
It is not clear what are you trying to do :(
Please close this PR, it is useless :(
@whiteshark008 please close this PR, it is absolutely useless
@dkandrov Could you please update PR according to the recent changes? I'll merge it :)

Why do you need additional 4 characters in method name? :)
And why copy/pasted method is added?

I think that "toXml" is prone to convert one thing to one Xml obejct.
It is a little confusing since the method outputs data to a Xml file.
Adding the additional 4 characters to make the method name more clear that the method is going to save the data to a Xml file.

I didn't remove the method "toXml" and just annotated is as"@Deprecated", since removing the method "toXml" might break the backward compatibility. 

The "toXml" can be remove in its future version.

The class has name `XmlExport`, its main purpose to export as XML
and there is no such this in Java as Xml object ....

not sure we will have clearer naming here ...
Thanks.

Weird enough: i got following error in Eclipse:

Description	Resource	Path	Location	Type
Footnote 'NioProcessor-2' is missing.	CHANGELOG.md	/openmeetings-parent	line 2148	WikiText Markup Problem

Looks like Eclipse decide that [NioProcessor-2] is a footnote link.
Same issue described [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/33840976/how-to-turn-off-error-reporting-by-eclipse-for-md-files).

You can try to change line:
```
* [OPENMEETINGS-234] - Video and Screen sharing not working with HTTPS and RTMPS - Java Application starts but doesnt connect - java trace logs shows "[WARN] [NioProcessor-2] org.red5.server.net.rtmps.RTMPSMinaIoHandler - Exception caught Keystore or password are null"
```
to the next one:
```
* [OPENMEETINGS-234] - Video and Screen sharing not working with HTTPS and RTMPS - Java Application starts but doesnt connect - java trace logs shows `[WARN] [NioProcessor-2] org.red5.server.net.rtmps.RTMPSMinaIoHandler - Exception caught Keystore or password are null`
```
Result should looks like below:
* [OPENMEETINGS-234] - Video and Screen sharing not working with HTTPS and RTMPS - Java Application starts but doesnt connect - java trace logs shows `[WARN] [NioProcessor-2] org.red5.server.net.rtmps.RTMPSMinaIoHandler - Exception caught Keystore or password are null`
Many thanks for the contribution!

This question might be already answered here: https://markmail.org/message/4vwp2ny4k4odwnwm

It's better ask questions on user@ mailing list: http://openmeetings.apache.org/mail-lists.html

hmm i got this configuration already … 
but isn't true that in their situation is Proxy HTTPS to HTTP?
In my case i would like to proxy HTTPS to HTTPS

The problem is there
example:

without proxy
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15123509/41908236-9930a2b0-7943-11e8-9982-19ae93dfc224.png)

with proxy
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15123509/41908105-2cb8d0d0-7943-11e8-8c14-06bd3f06c489.png)

It is impossible to set up HTTPS - HTTPS proxy, you will perform "double encrypting"
You can set up HTTPS front end proxy so it will do HTTPS, but underlying OM should be HTTP (with secure property set)

then changed to:

  RewriteRule .* ws://localhost:5080%{REQUEST_URI} [P]
  ProxyPass / http://localhost:5080/
  ProxyPassReverse / http://localhost:5080/

and still the same problem with this xml requests :(

About this property, i configured like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15123509/41909975-abef659e-7948-11e8-9b92-72ab779e7da2.png)
is it good?
or should i use tomcat without ssl but add this secure property?


update:

tried to comment out tomcat with ssl enabled, uncomment tomcat without ssl enabled, added secure property, same result.

Finally ….. it works !! 
so i have to comment out Tomcat with SSL enabled
Uncomment Tomcat without SSL enabled
Added secure property

and apache configuration should like this:

  ProxyPreserveHost On
  ProxyRequests Off
  ProxyPass / http://192.168.x.x/
  ProxyPassReverse / http://192.168.x.x/
  RewriteEngine on
  RewriteCond %{HTTP:UPGRADE} ^WebSocket$ [NC]
  RewriteCond %{HTTP:CONNECTION} ^Upgrade$ [NC]
  RewriteRule .* ws://192.168.x.x%{REQUEST_URI} [P]  
  etc.

as u can see proxy is for port 80. i changed in red5.properties 5080 to 80.

Thanks for help!!
Thanks for the contribution!
@solomax, I'm grateful to be part of an amazing application.

?

BTW, problem is not solved completely. Namely, I still don't know how to setup the same but with the port 5080? For some reasons I can't set the red5's port to 80, but 5080 is fine.

Hello,

sorry for the late response
Currently only Admin functions are available via SOAP/REST

I'm afraid rest functions will be too much work :(

Best guess: maybe your Apache server already uses port 80?

Please also check this answer: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51721771/apache-openmeetings-4-0-4-csrf-attack-when-using-apache2-as-proxypass/51783235#51783235

Yes, apache uses port 80. I commented out Tomcat with SSL enabled and uncommented Tomcat without SSL enabled, added string with secure property to the part with ssl disabled, my apache vhost looks as follows:

ProxyRequests Off                                                                                                                            
 ###      OpenMeetings    ### 
## Custom fragment                                                                                                                           
RewriteEngine On                                                                                                                             
RewriteCond %{HTTP:Connection} Upgrade [NC]                                                                                                 
RewriteCond %{HTTP:Upgrade} websocket [NC]                                                                                                  
RewriteRule /openmeetings/(.*) ws://localhost:5080/$1 [P,L]                                                                                
                                                                                    
ProxyPreserveHost On                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                             
<Location /openmeetings>                                                                                                                     
    Require all granted                                                                                                                      
    ProxyPass http://localhost:5080/openmeetings                                                                                             
    ProxyPassReverse http://localhost:5080/openmeetings                                                                                      
    RewriteEngine On                                                                                                                                                                                                  
</Location>                                                                                                                                  

As a result I can't login to openmeetings on local machine to http://localhost:5080/openmeetings, but I can login to https://externaladdress/openmeetings , and see only chat tab and nothing more with error in mozilla debugger:
 Content Security Policy: Couldn’t process unknown directive ‘’
Firefox can’t establish a connection to the server at wss://externaladdress/openmeetings/wicket/websocket?pageId=2&
When I remove string with security property then I can login on local machine.
![screenshot_2018-09-19_09-28-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4125496/45737730-eac21a80-bbee-11e8-86f6-a9fa0b6cd995.png)

Unfortunately it is impossible to support both forward to https proxy and local http
You should use one or another.

According to "Content Security Policy" error, have you tried the solution from my answer on StackOverflow?

> Unfortunately it is impossible to support both forward to https proxy and local http
> You should use one or another.

Ah, I see. 

> According to "Content Security Policy" error, have you tried the solution from my answer on StackOverflow?

Can you point me to this answer, please?

It was in this thread already :))))
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51721771/apache-openmeetings-4-0-4-csrf-attack-when-using-apache2-as-proxypass/51783235#51783235
Ah, this one. Yes, I used apache configs from your solution, see rewrite rules in my previous post.
As far as I can see they differs ....

Damn, it works!!! I put openmeetings configs into virtual host on port 80, but checked again your config and discovered that it should belongs to the virtual host on port 443. Now it works properly. Thank you very much. BTW, it would be good to add these recipes to documentation.

What would be the best place for this config?
It is already on stackoverflow (should be googled)
I can put it to opemeetings.apache.org -> Configuration -> Security/Networking ...
BTW are you planning to add some unit tests? would be great :)
@solomax I wish, unfortunately my health just deteriorated (fever) and won't be able work this weekend, although I will attempt to finalize your changes

Merged
Thanks!

`AppointmentManager.CONNECTION_MANAGER_TIMEOUT` seems to be no used in the code, is it done on purpose?
I couldn't find anything corresponding to that variable on the HttpClient 4.x's docs. page. So, I left it there on the off chance, I can find the corresponding setting for that.

This page is not intended to be displayed, it should perform immediate redirect, so shouldn't be a big deal :))

i add the <entry key="maxPostSize" value="-1"/> in the jee-container.xml,then restart the red5.sh command,next have a test,still has the problem.
F12 console log:
POST http://10.94.0.163:5080/openmeetings/?2-1.0-main~container-main-contents-child-roomContainer-wb~area-whiteboard net::ERR_CONNECTION_RESET
use chorme version 70.0.3538.102
@BennyFan  What the size of the data you are sending?
first i loaded a pdf file with size 1.9M to the whiteboard,then use the download as pdf function.

jee-container.xml update below:
`<property name="connectionProperties">
						<map>
							<entry key="maxHttpHeaderSize" value="${http.max_headers_size}"/>
							<entry key="maxKeepAliveRequests" value="${http.max_keep_alive_requests}"/>
                                            <entry key="maxPostSize" value="-1"/>
							<entry key="keepAliveTimout" value="-1"/>
						</map>
					</property>`

`maxPostSize` should be added 
to `connectorProperties`
NOT
to `connectionProperties`

the result should be:
```
<property name="connectorProperties">
    <map>
        <entry key="maxPostSize" value="-1"/>
    </map>
</property>
<property name="connectionProperties"> 
    <map> 
        <entry key="maxHttpHeaderSize" value="${http.max_headers_size}"/> 
        <entry key="maxKeepAliveRequests" value="${http.max_keep_alive_requests}"/> 
        <entry key="maxPostSize" value="-1"/> 
        <entry key="keepAliveTimout" value="-1"/> 
    </map> 
</property>
```

I'm very sorry. 
Now the test is Ok. 
Thank you again.

@antonjebods is it possible you are running 5.0.0-M1 with java11? (M1 requires java8 ...)

```mvn clean install``` fails too:

https://people.freebsd.org/~yuri/openmeetings-build-failure-1.log

@yurivict according to your logs your command was
`mvn clean install -Dmaven.test.skip=true`
NOT
`mvn clean install`

In case you would like to skip unit tests please use `-DskipTests=true` (the difference is described here [1])

[1] https://maven.apache.org/plugins-archives/maven-surefire-plugin-2.12.4/examples/skipping-test.html

It fails with tests being enabled too:
https://people.freebsd.org/~yuri/openmeetings-build-failure-2.log

@yurivict unfortunately web-service tests are unstable
This is why Apache Derby was replaced with H2 DB in 5.0.0-M2

You can try to rebuild, or skip unit test execution using `-DskipTests=true`

(for whatever reason this issue with tests is rarely happens on Ubuntu :(( )

It fails in a similar way with ```-DskipTests=true```:
```
Caused by: org.apache.maven.model.building.ModelBuildingException: 1 problem was encountered while building the effective model for xml-resolver:xml-resolver:1.2
[ERROR] 'distributionManagement.status' must not be specified. @ line 36, column 13

    at org.apache.maven.model.building.DefaultModelProblemCollector.newModelBuildingException (DefaultModelProblemCollector.java:197)
    at org.apache.maven.model.building.DefaultModelBuilder.build (DefaultModelBuilder.java:490)
    at org.apache.maven.model.building.DefaultModelBuilder.build (DefaultModelBuilder.java:432)
```

@yurivict as I wrote before these exceptions are caused by https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MPIR-374 and some unmaintained libraries
these errors can be ignored
This problem prevents me from creating a FreeBSD port for ```openmeetings```, because the package build can't be accessing the Internet.

Hello @yurivict 
what do you mean by `I have to first download dependencies into the dependency cache, save it`?

My steps were:
1) perform `mvn clean install -DskipTests=true`
2) then perform `mvn clean install -DskipTests=true -o`
Result: both builds were successful

`org.apache:apache:pom:21` is available in Maven Central

I believe the only way to `download dependencies into the dependency cache, save it` is:
1) perform full build in clean environment
2) preserve ~/.m2/repository
3) use repo saved on step 2) to perform offline build in clean environment

Steps to prepare the port's dependency cache:
1. mvn clean install -DskipTests=true
2. save the maven dependency cache

Steps to build the package:
1. Restore the maven dependency cache at the same location (in addition to regular sources)
2. mvn clean install -DskipTests=true --offline

This done because the package builder is not allowed to download anything.
The second step fails with ```--offline```

> use repo saved on step 2) to perform offline build in clean environment

This is what is done, and this fails.

what do you mean by `save the maven dependency cache`?
Something like `tar -czf m2repo.tgz ~/.m2/repository`?

> Something like tar -czf m2repo.tgz ~/.m2/repository?

Yes. It's being restored to the same condition as it was left.
Many other Java/maven-based ports do the same, this is why I am confident that the problem here is with the project, and not with the framework.

Double-checking it right now
Will take time ....
First step was `rm -rf  ~/.m2/repository/*`

You initial error `the artifact org.apache:apache:pom:21 has not been downloaded from it before`
Basically mean there is no `~/.m2/repository/org/apache/apache/21/apache-21.pom` in your saved maven repo
And this is weird ....
Could you please double-check your `saved maven cache` and check if this pom was archived?
